14.title: Evil Guest
14.description: Le Fanu’s inimitable style continues with The Evil Guest, a murder mystery fraught with dark imagery and mysterious characters. An unwanted guest visiting a dreary and isolated home is murdered; the thriller leads the reader down countless ‘dead’ ends before revealing the identity of the guilty party. (Introduction by Cathy Barratt)

sections.title: 01 (Beginning ... "Dear Madame, how happy -- how very happy you make me." (3893 words))
02 (Had Ithuriel touched with his spear, ... "Thank you ma'am -- God bless you," said the man, withdrawing. (3387 words))
03 (Mrs. Marston rang the bell ... yet mighty things were involved in the alternative. (3161 words))
04 (There was a deeper gloom than usual ... "which you fear to tell me of." (3333 words))
05 ("My looks! Why, curse it" ... "will, I fear, affect him most deplorably." (3029 words))
06 (The young man kissed her tenderly ... they were summoned together to prosecute. (3355 words))
07 (There remained still to be examined ... glance at ther companion, but did not speak. (3115 words))
09 ("He regards it as a merciful interposition" ... continued to sob and weep. (3343 words))
10 (The party were suddenly recalled ... wondering, and weeping. (3094 words))
11 (Two or three days passed, ... bleak and bitter enough they were. (3569 words))
12 (Some weeks passed away, ... among them in a horrid dream. (2437 words))
13 (Time passed on: ... "from which you would save him." (2161 words))
14 ("I am, myself, that patient," ... "What further happened you already know." (2952 words))
15 (Charles listened with breathless attention ... End. (2480 words))
